ExternalEncryptionRootKey.name: ExternalEncryptionRootKey
ExternalEncryptionRootKey.description: Represents metadata about root keys stored in third-party key stores that are used to generate and secure keys that encrypt Salesforce data.

ActivatedDate.description: The date the key was activated in Salesforce.

CreatedBy.description: The email address of the user who created the root key. For example, user@example.com.

Description.description: The user-defined description of the root key.

LastModifiedBy.description: The email address of the user who most recently modified the key. For example, user@example.com.

Region.description: The region for the customer managed key. For example, if the RootKeyService is AWS, the region is an Amazon Web Services (AWS) region such as us-east1.

RootKeyIdentifier.description: The unique key identifier from the external KMS, such as an AWS Amazon Resource Name (ARN). For example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:123456789000:key/123ab456-7cd8-9012-3e4f-5gh678i901j2

RootKeyService.description: The external key management service connected to Salesforce. For example, AWS.

Status.description: The status of the key. This is the only value that can be changed using update(). You can only change the status from Active to Inactive, or from Inactive to Active.
